decline_text: They're called back to camp, needed for other chores.

success_outcomes.text: The other apprentices ignore it, but it makes app1 laugh, muffled through {PRONOUN/app1/poss} own cobweb gathering stick. It's good to have a friend around for the boring bits of the day, and app2 seems to lighten up every situation.

Murrping with laughter, app1 clacks the stick {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/hold/holds} in {PRONOUN/app1/poss} own mouth against app2's. The stick bashing continues as {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/collect/collects} cobwebs, and the afternoon is filled with the two's muffled purrs and laughs, even though the other apprentices seem solely focused on the chore, content to let the others muck about so long as everything gets done.

fail_outcomes.text: The apprentices spend the entire patrol messing around with their sticks, even when there are cobwebs spun around the ends of them, and they end up completely ruining what they've gathered...

intro_text: The apprentices head out into the territory, following p_l a little dubiously. Gathering things can't possibly be as hard as hunting them - plants don't run away!
decline_text: They're called back to camp, needed for other chores.

success_outcomes.text: It's a long, weird, hard day. Yes, the cobwebs. Yes, they bring them back to camp - but by StarClan, none of the warrior apprentices were expecting something as simple as cobweb gathering to be so hard, not when it feels like they run into one every other hunt! They definitely end up with a new appreciation for p_l's skills.

... However, once out of camp, the apprentices realize they're out of their depth, and turn to p_l for help. p_l, to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} credit, is very gracious about it, not making anyone feel stupid, and by the time the patrol returns with a successful haul, there's a new feeling of rapport between everyone, regardless of their role.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l is disgusted with the general disdain {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/feel/feels} from the other apprentices and how hypocritical it is to tell them herb gathering is easy when the patrol hasn't found any cobwebs! {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/stalk/stalks} back to the medicine cat den in a huff, unable to bear being near the other apprentices for any longer than {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/have/has} been.

decline_text: They're called back to camp, needed for other chores.

success_outcomes.text: There's nothing to apologize for! r_c bumps p_l's shoulder affectionately, brushing past {PRONOUN/p_l/self} with a smile as {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/leave/leaves} camp. It's a fine way to spend the afternoon and a cool cat to spend it with!

r_c seems somewhat irritated at first, but as p_l keeps chatting to {PRONOUN/p_l/self}, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/start/starts} to warm up, and both apprentices feel much more comfortable with each other by the time they bring their mossy loot back to camp.
